intro: Atropa contorta, commonly known as the narrowleaf nightshade, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant features distinctive, narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, violet-blue flowers. Its berries are toxic and contain tropane alkaloids, which have been studied for their medicinal properties. Atropa contorta is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats.
